content.description: Figure 1. Formation of a peptide bond
content.question: Which of the following best describes the formation of the bond shown in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: An ionic bond is formed between a carbon atom of one amino acid and the nitrogen atom of the other amino acid.

An ionic bond is formed when the negative charge of an <math alttext="O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> group is balanced by the positive charge of a hydrogen ion.

A covalent bond is formed between a carbon atom and a nitrogen atom along with the formation of <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> .

A covalent bond is formed that replaces the hydrogen bond between the <math alttext="O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> group and the <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atom.

content.answer: A covalent bond is formed between a carbon atom and a nitrogen atom along with the formation of <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> .
